classes.name: LdapClientFactory
classes.description: Create new non persisted ldap connections.

classes.name: LdapClient
classes.description: Connection to ldap server.

classes.name: LdapEntry
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding information about an LDAP
entry. An entry contains a distinguished name (DN) and a set of attributes.
An entry can be created from these components, and it can also be created
from its LDIF representation as described in RFC 2849.

classes.name: LdapAttribute
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding information about an LDAP attribute, which
includes an attribute name (which may include a set of attribute options) and zero or more values.

methods.name: getAttributeName
methods.description: Retrieves the name of the attribute to target with this modification.

methods.name: getValues
methods.description: the set of values for this modification as an array of strings.

methods.name: getValueByteArrays
methods.description: Retrieves the set of values for this modification as an array of byte arrays

classes.name: LdapResult
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding the elements that are common to most types of
LDAP responses.

classes.name: LdapSearchRequest
classes.description:
This class implements the processing necessary to perform an LDAPv3 search operation, which can
be used to retrieve entries that match a given set of criteria.

methods.name: create
methods.parameters: baseDN: string, filter: string, scope: LdapSearchScope, attributes: string[], derefPolicy: LdapDereferencePolicy, sizeLimit: number, timeLimit: number, typesOnly: boolean

classes.name: LdapDeleteRequest
classes.description:
This class implements the processing necessary to perform an LDAPv3 search operation, which can
be used to retrieve entries that match a given set of criteria.

classes.name: LdapSearchResult
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding information about the result of processing a
search request.

classes.name: LdapDN
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding information about an LDAP distinguished name
(DN). A DN consists of a comma-delimited list of zero or more RDN components.

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Creates a new DN from the provided string representation.

methods.name: fromRdns
methods.description: Creates a new DN with the provided set of RDNs.

methods.name: fromParentDn
methods.description: Creates a new DN below the provided parent DN with the given RDN.

methods.name: getRDN
methods.description:
Retrieves the leftmost (i.e., furthest from the naming context) RDN component for this
DN.

methods.name: getRDNString
methods.description:
Retrieves the string representation of the leftmost (i.e., furthest from the naming
context) RDN component for this DN.

methods.name: getRDNs
methods.description: Retrieves the set of RDNs that comprise this DN.

methods.name: getRDNStrings
methods.description: Retrieves the set of string representations of the RDNs that comprise this DN.

methods.name: isNullDN
methods.description:
Indicates whether this DN represents the null DN, which does not have any RDN
components.

methods.name: getParent
methods.description:
Retrieves the DN that is the parent for this DN. Note that neither the null DN nor DNs
consisting of a single RDN component will be considered to have parent DNs.

methods.name: getParentString
methods.description:
Retrieves the string representation of the DN that is the parent for this DN. Note that
neither the null DN nor DNs consisting of a single RDN component will be considered to have
parent DNs.

methods.name: isAncestorOf
methods.description:
Indicates whether this DN is an ancestor of the provided DN. It will be considered an
ancestor of the provided DN if the array of RDN components for the provided DN ends with the
elements that comprise the array of RDN components for this DN (i.e., if the provided DN is
subordinate to, or optionally equal to, this DN). The null DN will be considered an ancestor for
all other DNs (with the exception of the null DN if allowEquals is false).

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Indicates whether the provided object is equal to this DN. In order for the provided
object to be considered equal, it must be a non-null DN with the same set of RDN components.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Retrieves a string representation of this DN.

methods.name: toNormalizedString
methods.description: Retrieves a normalized string representation of this DN.

classes.name: LdapRDN
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for holding information about an LDAP relative
distinguished name (RDN). An RDN consists of one or more attribute name-value pairs.

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Creates a new RDN from the provided string representation.

methods.name: fromNameValue
methods.description: Creates a new single-valued RDN with the provided information.

methods.name: getAttributeNames
methods.description: Retrieves the set of attribute names for this RDN.

methods.name: getAttributeValues
methods.description: Retrieves the set of attribute values for this RDN.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Retrieves a string representation of this RDN.

methods.name: toNormalizedString
methods.description: Retrieves a normalized string representation of this RDN.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Indicates whether the provided object is equal to this RDN. The given object will only
be considered equal to this RDN if it is also an RDN with the same set of names and values.

classes.name: LdapSubtreeDeleteRequestControl
classes.description:
TThis class provides an implementation of the subtree delete request control as defined in
draft-armijo-ldap-treedelete. This can be used to delete an entry and all subordinate entries in a
single operation."

classes.name: LdapSimplePagedResultsControl
classes.description:
This class provides an implementation of the simple paged results control as defined in RFC
2696.
It allows the client to iterate through a potentially large set of search results in subsets of a
specified
number of entries (i.e., "pages")."

classes.name: LdapSearchResultReference
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure for representing an LDAP search result reference. A search
result reference consists of a set of referral URLs and may also include zero or more controls. It
describes an alternate location in which additional results for the search may be found. If there are
multiple referral URLs, then they should all be considered equivalent ways to access the information
(e.g., referrals referencing different servers that may be contacted).

classes.name: AD_HostManager
classes.description: Manage Active Directory hosts

methods.name: findHost
methods.description: Return Active Directory hosts by it's configuration id.

methods.name: findAllHosts
methods.description: Return all Active Directory hosts.

classes.name: ConfigurationManager
classes.description: Manage Active Directory plug-in configuration

methods.name: saveConfiguration
methods.description: Save Active Directory server configuration.

methods.name: deleteConfiguration
methods.description: Delete Active Directory server configuration with the specified id.

methods.name: validateConfiguration
methods.description: Validate Active Directory configuration.

classes.name: ActiveDirectory
classes.description: Represents the Active Directory base.

methods.name: search
methods.parameters: type: string, query: string, adServer: AD_Host
methods.description: Search the active directory for a certain type of object

methods.name: searchExactMatch
methods.parameters: type: string, objectName: string, limit: number, adServer: AD_Host
methods.description:
Search the active directory for a certain type of object. Object will be returned only
if the there is
exact match.

methods.name: getComputerAD
methods.description: Returns a computer when his exact name is given. If no computer found, returns null

methods.name: getDC
methods.description: Return the AD_Computer representing the Domain Conroller

methods.name: rename
methods.parameters: from: string, to: string, new_parent: string, adServer: AD_Host
methods.description: Move Ad Object to a diferent OU or rename

methods.name: searchForEntry
methods.parameters: baseDN: string, searchScope: LdapSearchScope, timeLimit: number, filter: string, attributes: string, host: AD_Host
methods.description:
Processes a search operation with the provided information. It is expected that at most one entry will be 
returned from the search, and that no additional content from the successful search result 
(e.g., diagnostic message or response controls) are needed.

methods.description: Allows a client to change the leftmost (least significant) component of the name of an entry in the directory. Тo rename the entry you must provide it with the attribute as prefix - e.g. "cn=newName".

classes.name: LdapSearchScope
classes.description: Ldap search scope

classes.name: LdapDereferencePolicy
classes.description:
This class defines a data type for dereference policy values. Clients should
generally use one of the {@code NEVER}, {@code SEARCHING}, {@code FINDING},
{@code ALWAYS} values.

classes.name: LdapFilter
classes.description:
This class provides a data structure that represents an LDAP search filter. It provides methods
for as parsing a filter from a string. See RFC 4515 for more information about representing search
filters as strings.

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new search filter from the provided string representation.

methods.name: encodeValue
methods.description:
Encodes the provided value into a form suitable for use as the assertion value in the
string representation of a search filter. Parentheses, asterisks, backslashes, null characters,
and any non-ASCII characters will be escaped using a backslash before the hexadecimal
representation of each byte in the character to escape.

methods.name: encodeValueBytes
methods.description:
Encodes the provided value into a form suitable for use as the assertion value in the
string representation of a search filter. Parentheses, asterisks, backslashes, null characters,
and any non-ASCII characters will be escaped using a backslash before the hexadecimal
representation of each byte in the character to escape.

methods.name: getValue
methods.description: Returns load balancing mode as string.

methods.name: getValuesAsString
methods.description: Returns supported load balancing modes .

methods.name: fromString
methods.description: Create LdapLoadBalancingMode object from it's string representation.
